get.description: List invoices with optional filtering

parameters.name: amount_due_gt
parameters.description:
amount_due_gt filters invoices with a total amount due greater than the specified value
Useful for finding invoices above a certain threshold or identifying high-value invoices

parameters.name: amount_remaining_gt
parameters.description:
amount_remaining_gt filters invoices with an outstanding balance greater than the specified value
Useful for finding invoices that still have significant unpaid amounts

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description:
customer_id filters invoices for a specific customer using FlexPrice's internal customer ID
This is the ID returned by FlexPrice when creating or retrieving customers

parameters.name: external_customer_id
parameters.description:
external_customer_id filters invoices for a customer using your system's customer identifier
This is the ID you provided when creating the customer in FlexPrice

parameters.name: invoice_ids
parameters.description:
invoice_ids restricts results to invoices with the specified IDs
Use this to retrieve specific invoices when you know their exact identifiers

parameters.name: invoice_status
parameters.description:
invoice_status filters by the current state of invoices in their lifecycle
Multiple statuses can be specified to include invoices in any of the listed states

parameters.name: invoice_type
parameters.description:
invoice_type filters by the nature of the invoice (SUBSCRIPTION, ONE_OFF, or CREDIT)
Use this to separate recurring charges from one-time fees or credit adjustments

parameters.name: payment_status
parameters.description:
payment_status filters by the payment state of invoices
Multiple statuses can be specified to include invoices with any of the listed payment states

parameters.name: skip_line_items
parameters.description: SkipLineItems if true, will not include line items in the response

parameters.name: subscription_id
parameters.description:
subscription_id filters invoices generated for a specific subscription
Only returns invoices that were created as part of the specified subscription's billing

400.description: Bad request - missing parameters or invalid signature

address_city.description: AddressCity is the city of the customer's address

address_country.description: AddressCountry is the country of the customer's address (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2)

address_line1.description: AddressLine1 is the first line of the customer's address

address_line2.description: AddressLine2 is the second line of the customer's address

address_postal_code.description: AddressPostalCode is the postal code of the customer's address

address_state.description: AddressState is the state of the customer's address

email.description: Email is the email of the customer

environment_id.description: EnvironmentID is the environment identifier for the customer

external_id.description: ExternalID is the external identifier for the customer

id.description: ID is the unique identifier for the customer

name.description: Name is the name of the customer

billing_anchor.description: billing_anchor is the new billing anchor

billing_period_count.description: billing_period_count is the billing period count

period_end.description: period_end is the end of the new billing period

period_start.description: period_start is the start of the new billing period

meter_id.description: MeterID references the meter to track usage

period_start.description: Optional time range. If not provided, uses entire subscription period

subscription_id.description: SubscriptionID is required to get subscription details

reason.description: Reason for cancellation (for audit and business intelligence)

cost.description: Cost is the calculated cost for this meter

meter_name.description: MeterName is the display name of the meter

items.description: Items contains the breakdown by meter

total_cost.description: TotalCost is the sum of all meter costs

meter_id.description: MeterID references the meter to track usage

amount.description: amount is the monetary amount to be credited for this line item

display_name.description: display_name is an optional human-readable name for this credit note line item

invoice_line_item_id.description: invoice_line_item_id is the unique identifier of the invoice line item being credited

credit_note_number.description: credit_note_number is an optional human-readable identifier for the credit note

idempotency_key.description: idempotency_key is an optional key used to prevent duplicate credit note creation

invoice_id.description: invoice_id is the unique identifier of the invoice this credit note is applied to

line_items.description: line_items contains the individual line items that make up this credit note (minimum 1 required)

memo.description: memo is an optional free-text field for additional notes about the credit note

process_credit_note.description: process_credit_note is a flag to process the credit note after creation

address_city.description: address_city is the city name with maximum 100 characters

address_country.description: address_country is the two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code

address_line1.description: address_line1 is the primary address line with maximum 255 characters

address_line2.description: address_line2 is the secondary address line with maximum 255 characters

address_postal_code.description: address_postal_code is the ZIP code or postal code with maximum 20 characters

address_state.description: address_state is the state, province, or region name with maximum 100 characters

email.description: email is the customer's email address and must be a valid email format if provided

external_id.description: external_id is the unique identifier from your system to reference this customer (required)

integration_entity_mapping.description: integration_entity_mapping contains provider integration mappings for this customer

metadata.description: metadata contains additional key-value pairs for storing extra information

name.description: name is the full name or company name of the customer

tax_rate_overrides.description: tax_rate_overrides contains tax rate configurations to be linked to this customer

dto.CreateCustomerRequest.description: Request object for creating a new customer in the system

amount.description: amount is the monetary amount for this line item

display_name.description: display_name is the optional human-readable name for this line item

entity_id.description: entity_id is the optional unique identifier of the entity associated with this line item

entity_type.description: entity_type is the optional type of the entity associated with this line item

meter_display_name.description: meter_display_name is the optional human-readable name of the meter

meter_id.description: meter_id is the optional unique identifier of the meter used for usage tracking

period_end.description: period_end is the optional end date of the period this line item covers

period_start.description: period_start is the optional start date of the period this line item covers

plan_display_name.description: plan_display_name is the optional human-readable name of the plan

TODO: !REMOVE after migration
plan_id is the optional unique identifier of the plan associated with this line item

price_id.description: price_id is the optional unique identifier of the price associated with this line item

price_type.description: price_type indicates the type of pricing (fixed, usage, tiered, etc.)

price_unit.description: price_unit is the optional 3-digit ISO code of the price unit associated with this line item

price_unit_amount.description: price_unit_amount is the optional amount converted to the price unit currency

quantity.description: quantity is the quantity of units for this line item

amount_due.description: amount_due is the total amount that needs to be paid for this invoice

amount_paid.description: amount_paid is the amount that has been paid towards this invoice

billing_period.description: billing_period is the period this invoice covers (e.g., "monthly", "yearly")

currency.description: currency is the three-letter ISO currency code (e.g., USD, EUR) for the invoice

customer_id.description: customer_id is the unique identifier of the customer this invoice belongs to

description.description: description is an optional text description of the invoice

due_date.description: due_date is the date by which payment is expected

environment_id.description: environment_id is the unique identifier of the environment this invoice belongs to

idempotency_key.description: idempotency_key is an optional key used to prevent duplicate invoice creation

invoice_number.description: invoice_number is an optional human-readable identifier for the invoice

invoice_pdf_url.description: invoice_pdf_url is the URL where customers can download the PDF version of this invoice

line_items.description: line_items contains the individual items that make up this invoice

period_end.description: period_end is the end date of the billing period

period_start.description: period_start is the start date of the billing period

prepared_tax_rates.description:
prepared_tax_rates contains the tax rates pre-resolved by the caller (e.g., billing service)
These are applied at invoice level by the invoice service without further resolution

subscription_id.description: subscription_id is the optional unique identifier of the subscription associated with this invoice

subtotal.description: subtotal is the amount before taxes and discounts are applied

tax_rate_overrides.description: tax_rate_overrides is the tax rate overrides to be applied to the invoice

total.description: total is the total amount of the invoice including taxes and discounts

entity_id.description: TODO: this will be required in the future as we will not allow prices to be created without an entity id

plan_id.description: TODO: This is deprecated and will be removed in the future

entity_id.description: TODO: this will be required in the future as we will not allow prices to be created without an entity id

plan_id.description: TODO: This is deprecated and will be removed in the future

flat_amount.description:
flat_amount is the flat amount for the given tier (optional)
Applied on top of unit_amount*quantity. Useful for cases like "2.7$ + 5c"

unit_amount.description: unit_amount is the amount per unit for the given tier

up_to.description:
up_to is the quantity up to which this tier applies. It is null for the last tier.
IMPORTANT: Tier boundaries are INCLUSIVE.
- If up_to is 1000, then quantity less than or equal to 1000 belongs to this tier
- This behavior is consistent across both VOLUME and SLAB tier modes

addons.description: Addons represents addons to be added to the subscription during creation

commitment_amount.description: CommitmentAmount is the minimum amount a customer commits to paying for a billing period

coupons.description: SubscriptionCoupons is a list of coupon IDs to be applied to the subscription

credit_grants.description: Credit grants to be applied when subscription is created

customer_id.description:
customer_id is the flexprice customer id
and it is prioritized over external_customer_id in case both are provided.

customer_timezone.description:
Timezone of the customer.
If not set, the default value is UTC.

external_customer_id.description:
external_customer_id is the customer id in your DB
and must be same as what you provided as external_id while creating the customer in flexprice.

line_item_coupons.description: SubscriptionLineItemsCoupons is a list of coupon IDs to be applied to the subscription line items

overage_factor.description: OverageFactor is a multiplier applied to usage beyond the commitment amount

override_line_items.description: OverrideLineItems allows customizing specific prices for this subscription

phases.description: Phases represents an optional timeline of subscription phases

tax_rate_overrides.description: tax_rate_overrides is the tax rate overrides	to be applied to the subscription

code.description: code is the unique alphanumeric case sensitive identifier for the tax rate (required)

description.description: description is an optional text description providing details about the tax rate

fixed_value.description: fixed_value is the fixed monetary amount when tax_rate_type is "fixed"

metadata.description: metadata contains additional key-value pairs for storing extra information

name.description: name is the human-readable name for the tax rate (required)

percentage_value.description: percentage_value is the percentage value (0-100) when tax_rate_type is "percentage"

alert_enabled.description:
alert_enabled is the flag to enable alerts for the wallet
defaults to true, can be explicitly set to false to disable alerts

conversion_rate.description:
amount in the currency =  number of credits * conversion_rate
ex if conversion_rate is 1, then 1 USD = 1 credit
ex if conversion_rate is 2, then 1 USD = 0.5 credits
ex if conversion_rate is 0.5, then 1 USD = 2 credits

external_customer_id.description: external_customer_id is the customer id in the external system

initial_credits_expiry_date_utc.description:
initial_credits_expiry_date_utc is the expiry date in UTC timezone (optional to set nil means no expiry)
ex 2025-01-01 00:00:00 UTC

initial_credits_to_load.description:
initial_credits_to_load is the number of credits to load to the wallet
if not provided, the wallet will be created with 0 balance
NOTE: this is not the amount in the currency, but the number of credits

initial_credits_to_load_expiry_date.description:
initial_credits_to_load_expiry_date YYYYMMDD format in UTC timezone (optional to set nil means no expiry)
for ex 20250101 means the credits will expire on 2025-01-01 00:00:00 UTC
hence they will be available for use until 2024-12-31 23:59:59 UTC

property_filters.description: Property filters to filter the events by the keys in `properties` field of the event

billing_anchor.description:
BillingAnchor enables custom monthly billing periods for meter usage aggregation.

Usage guidelines:
- Only effective when WindowSize = "MONTH"
- For other window sizes (DAY, HOUR, WEEK), this field is ignored
- When nil, uses standard calendar months (1st to 1st)
- When provided, creates custom monthly periods (e.g., 5th to 5th)

Common use cases:
- Subscription billing periods that don't align with calendar months
- Customer-specific billing cycles (e.g., signed up on 15th)
- Multi-tenant systems with different billing anchor dates

Example: If BillingAnchor = "2024-03-05T14:30:45Z" and WindowSize = "MONTH":
  - March period: 2024-03-05 14:30:45 to 2024-04-05 14:30:45
  - April period: 2024-04-05 14:30:45 to 2024-05-05 14:30:45

BillingAnchor enables custom monthly billing periods for usage aggregation.

When to use:
- WindowSize = "MONTH" AND you need custom monthly periods (not calendar months)
- Subscription billing that doesn't align with calendar months
- Example: Customer signed up on 15th, so billing periods are 15th to 15th

When NOT to use:
- WindowSize != "MONTH" (ignored for DAY, HOUR, WEEK, etc.)
- Standard calendar-based billing (1st to 1st of each month)

Example values:
- "2024-03-05T14:30:45.123456789Z" (5th of each month at 2:30:45 PM)
- "2024-01-15T00:00:00Z" (15th of each month at midnight)
- "2024-02-29T12:00:00Z" (29th of each month at noon - handles leap years)

tenant_id.description: tenant_id is the unique identifier of the tenant this line item belongs to

updated_at.description: updated_at is the timestamp when this line item was last updated

updated_by.description: updated_by is the identifier of the user who last updated this line item

usage_analytics.description: usage_analytics contains usage analytics for this line item (legacy - grouped by source)

usage_breakdown.description: usage_breakdown contains flexible usage breakdown for this line item (supports any grouping)

currency.description: currency is the currency for all amounts

due_date.description: due_date is when the invoice would be due

line_items.description: line_items contains preview of line items

subtotal.description: subtotal is the subtotal amount before taxes

tax_amount.description: tax_amount is the total tax amount

total.description: total is the total amount including taxes

amount_due.description: amount_due is the total amount that needs to be paid for this invoice

amount_paid.description: amount_paid is the amount that has been paid towards this invoice

amount_remaining.description: amount_remaining is the amount still outstanding on this invoice

billing_period.description: billing_period is the period this invoice covers (e.g., "monthly", "yearly")

billing_reason.description: billing_reason indicates why this invoice was created (subscription_cycle, manual, etc.)

billing_sequence.description: billing_sequence is the optional sequence number for billing cycles

coupon_applications.description: coupon_applications contains the coupon applications associated with this invoice

created_at.description: created_at is the timestamp when this invoice was created

created_by.description: created_by is the identifier of the user who created this invoice

currency.description: currency is the three-letter ISO currency code (e.g., USD, EUR) for the invoice

customer_id.description: customer_id is the unique identifier of the customer this invoice belongs to

description.description: description is the optional text description of the invoice

due_date.description: due_date is the date by which payment is expected

finalized_at.description: finalized_at is the timestamp when this invoice was finalized

id.description: id is the unique identifier for this invoice

idempotency_key.description: idempotency_key is the optional key used to prevent duplicate invoice creation

invoice_number.description: invoice_number is the optional human-readable identifier for the invoice

invoice_pdf_url.description: invoice_pdf_url is the optional URL to the PDF version of this invoice

line_items.description: line_items contains the individual items that make up this invoice

overpaid_amount.description: overpaid_amount is the amount overpaid if payment_status is OVERPAID (amount_paid - total)

paid_at.description: paid_at is the timestamp when this invoice was paid

period_end.description: period_end is the end date of the billing period

period_start.description: period_start is the start date of the billing period

status.description: status represents the current status of this invoice

subscription_id.description: subscription_id is the optional unique identifier of the subscription associated with this invoice

subtotal.description: subtotal is the amount before taxes and discounts are applied

taxes.description: tax_applied_records contains the tax applied records associated with this invoice

tenant_id.description: tenant_id is the unique identifier of the tenant this invoice belongs to

total.description: total is the total amount of the invoice including taxes and discounts

total_discount.description: total_discount is the total discount amount from coupon applications

total_tax.description: total_tax is the total tax amount for this invoice

updated_at.description: updated_at is the timestamp when this invoice was last updated

updated_by.description: updated_by is the identifier of the user who last updated this invoice

version.description: version is the version number of this invoice

voided_at.description: voided_at is the timestamp when this invoice was voided

dto.ListCustomersResponse.description: Response object for listing customers with pagination

items.description:
List of subscription pause objects
@Description Array of subscription pauses

total.description:
Total number of pauses
@Description Total count of subscription pauses in the response

dto.ListSubscriptionPausesResponse.description: Response object for listing subscription pauses with total count

amount.description: Amount is the new price amount that overrides the original price (optional)

price_id.description: PriceID references the plan price to override

tiers.description: Tiers determines the pricing tiers for this line item

dto.PauseSubscriptionRequest.description: Request object for pausing an active subscription with various pause modes and options

amount.description:
Amount stored in main currency units (e.g., dollars, not cents)
For USD: 12.50 means $12.50

billing_period_count.description: BillingPeriodCount is the count of the billing period ex 1, 3, 6, 12

conversion_rate.description:
ConversionRate is the rate of the price unit to the base currency
For BTC: 1 BTC = 100000000 USD

currency.description: Currency 3 digit ISO currency code in lowercase ex usd, eur, gbp

display_amount.description:
DisplayAmount is the formatted amount with currency symbol
For USD: $12.50

display_price_unit_amount.description:
DisplayPriceUnitAmount is the formatted amount with price unit symbol
For BTC: 0.00000001 BTC

end_date.description: EndDate is the end date of the price

entity_id.description: EntityID holds the value of the "entity_id" field.

environment_id.description: EnvironmentID is the environment identifier for the price

id.description: ID uuid identifier for the price

lookup_key.description: LookupKey used for looking up the price in the database

meter_id.description: MeterID is the id of the meter for usage based pricing

parent_price_id.description: ParentPriceID references the parent price (only set when scope is SUBSCRIPTION)

plan_id.description: TODO: Remove this once we have a proper price entity type

price_unit.description:
PriceUnit 3 digit ISO currency code in lowercase ex btc
For BTC: btc

price_unit_amount.description:
PriceUnitAmount is the amount stored in price unit
For BTC: 0.00000001 means 0.00000001 BTC

price_unit_id.description: PriceUnitID is the id of the price unit

price_unit_tiers.description: PriceUnitTiers are the tiers for the price unit

start_date.description: StartDate is the start date of the price

trial_period.description:
TrialPeriod is the number of days for the trial period
Note: This is only applicable for recurring prices (BILLING_CADENCE_RECURRING)

charge_amount.description: charge_amount is the charge amount for the new subscription

charge_description.description: charge_description describes what the charge is for

credit_amount.description: credit_amount is the credit amount from the old subscription

credit_description.description: credit_description describes what the credit is for

currency.description: currency is the currency for all amounts

current_period_end.description: current_period_end is the end of the current billing period

current_period_start.description: current_period_start is the start of the current billing period

days_remaining.description: days_remaining is the number of days remaining in the current period

days_used.description: days_used is the number of days used in the current period

net_amount.description: net_amount is the net amount (charge - credit)

proration_date.description: proration_date is the date used for proration calculations

dto.ResumeSubscriptionRequest.description: Request object for resuming a paused subscription

cost.description: cost is the cost attributed to this source for the line item

event_count.description: event_count is the number of events from this source (optional)

percentage.description: percentage is the percentage of total line item cost from this source (optional)

source.description: source is the name of the event source

usage.description: usage is the total usage amount from this source (optional, for additional context)

credit_grants.description: credit_grants contains any credit grants created for proration credits

effective_date.description: effective_date is when the change took effect

dto.SubscriptionChangeExecuteResponse.description: Response after successfully executing a subscription plan change

effective_date.description: effective_date is when the change would take effect

subscription_id.description: subscription_id is the ID of the subscription being changed

warnings.description: warnings contains any warnings about the change

dto.SubscriptionChangePreviewResponse.description: Response showing the financial impact of a subscription plan change

billing_period_count.description: billing_period_count is the billing period count for the new subscription

metadata.description: metadata contains additional key-value pairs for storing extra information

target_plan_id.description: target_plan_id is the ID of the new plan to change to (required)

dto.SubscriptionChangeRequest.description: Request object for changing a subscription plan (upgrade/downgrade)

environment_id.description: EnvironmentID is the environment identifier for the pause

id.description: ID is the unique identifier for the subscription pause

original_period_end.description: OriginalPeriodEnd is the end of the billing period when the pause was created

original_period_start.description: OriginalPeriodStart is the start of the billing period when the pause was created

pause_end.description: PauseEnd is when the pause will end (null for indefinite)

pause_start.description: PauseStart is when the pause actually started

reason.description: Reason is the reason for pausing

resumed_at.description: ResumedAt is when the pause was actually ended (if manually resumed)

subscription_id.description: SubscriptionID is the identifier for the subscription

dto.SubscriptionPauseResponse.description: Response object containing subscription pause information

active_pause_id.description:
ActivePauseID references the current active pause configuration
This will be null if no pause is active or scheduled

billing_anchor.description:
BillingAnchor is the reference point that aligns future billing cycle dates.
It sets the day of week for week intervals, the day of month for month and year intervals,
and the month of year for year intervals. The timestamp is in UTC format.

billing_period_count.description: BillingPeriodCount is the total number units of the billing period.

cancel_at.description: CancelAt is the date the subscription will be canceled

cancel_at_period_end.description: CancelAtPeriodEnd is whether the subscription was canceled at the end of the current period

cancelled_at.description: CanceledAt is the date the subscription was canceled

collection_method.description: CollectionMethod determines how invoices are collected

commitment_amount.description: CommitmentAmount is the minimum amount a customer commits to paying for a billing period

coupon_associations.description: CouponAssociations are the coupon associations for this subscription

currency.description: Currency is the currency of the subscription in lowercase 3 digit ISO codes

current_period_end.description:
CurrentPeriodEnd is the end of the current period that the subscription has been invoiced for.
At the end of this period, a new invoice will be created.

current_period_start.description:
CurrentPeriodStart is the end of the current period that the subscription has been invoiced for.
At the end of this period, a new invoice will be created.

customer_id.description: CustomerID is the identifier for the customer in our system

end_date.description: EndDate is the end date of the subscription

environment_id.description: EnvironmentID is the environment identifier for the subscription

gateway_payment_method_id.description: GatewayPaymentMethodID is the gateway payment method ID for this subscription

id.description: ID is the unique identifier for the subscription

lookup_key.description: LookupKey is the key used to lookup the subscription in our system

overage_factor.description: OverageFactor is a multiplier applied to usage beyond the commitment amount

payment_behavior.description: PaymentBehavior determines how subscription payments are handled

plan_id.description: PlanID is the identifier for the plan in our system

start_date.description: StartDate is the start date of the subscription

trial_end.description: TrialEnd is the end date of the trial period

trial_start.description: TrialStart is the start date of the trial period

version.description: Version is used for optimistic locking

is_overage.description: Whether this charge is at overage rate

overage_factor.description: Factor applied to this charge if in overage

amount.description:
amount is the amount in the currency of the wallet to be added
NOTE: this is not the number of credits to add, but the amount in the currency
amount = credits_to_add * conversion_rate
if both amount and credits_to_add are provided, amount will be ignored
ex if the wallet has a conversion_rate of 2 then adding an amount of
10 USD in the wallet wil add 5 credits in the wallet

credits_to_add.description: credits_to_add is the number of credits to add to the wallet

description.description: description to add any specific details about the transaction

expiry_date_utc.description:
expiry_date_utc is the expiry date in UTC timezone
ex 2025-01-01 00:00:00 UTC

idempotency_key.description: idempotency_key is a unique key for the transaction

priority.description:
priority is the priority of the transaction
lower number means higher priority
default is nil which means no priority at all

id.description: ID of the costsheet to update

address_city.description: address_city is the updated city name with maximum 100 characters

address_country.description: address_country is the updated two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code

address_line1.description: address_line1 is the updated primary address line with maximum 255 characters

address_line2.description: address_line2 is the updated secondary address line with maximum 255 characters

address_postal_code.description: address_postal_code is the updated postal code with maximum 20 characters

address_state.description: address_state is the updated state, province, or region name with maximum 100 characters

email.description: email is the updated email address and must be a valid email format if provided

external_id.description: external_id is the updated external identifier for the customer

integration_entity_mapping.description: integration_entity_mapping contains provider integration mappings for this customer

metadata.description: metadata contains updated key-value pairs that will replace existing metadata

name.description: name is the updated name or company name for the customer

dto.UpdateCustomerRequest.description: Request object for updating an existing customer. All fields are optional - only provided fields will be updated

invoice_pdf_url.description: invoice_pdf_url is the URL where customers can download the PDF version of this invoice

amount.description: amount is the optional payment amount to record

id.description: The ID of the credit grant to update (present if the credit grant is being updated)
The ID of the entitlement to update (present if the entitlement is being updated)

entity_id.description: TODO: this will be required in the future as we will not allow prices to be created without an entity id

id.description: The ID of the price to update (present if the price is being updated)

plan_id.description: TODO: This is deprecated and will be removed in the future

code.description: code is the updated unique alphanumeric identifier for the tax rate

description.description: description is the updated text description for the tax rate

metadata.description: metadata contains updated key-value pairs that will replace existing metadata

name.description: name is the updated human-readable name for the tax rate

event_count.description: Number of events that contributed to this aggregation

properties.description: Stores property values for flexible grouping (e.g., org_id -> "org123")

event_count.description: Number of events in this time window

cost.description: cost is the cost attributed to this group for the line item

event_count.description: event_count is the number of events from this group (optional)

grouped_by.description: grouped_by contains the grouping field values (e.g., {"source": "api", "org_id": "org123"})

percentage.description: percentage is the percentage of total line item cost from this group (optional)

usage.description: usage is the total usage amount from this group (optional, for additional context)

field.description:
Field is the key in $event.properties on which the aggregation is to be applied
For ex if the aggregation type is sum for API usage, the field could be "duration_ms"

multiplier.description:
Multiplier is the multiplier for the aggregation
For ex if the aggregation type is sum_with_multiplier for API usage, the multiplier could be 1000
to scale up by a factor of 1000. If not provided, it will be null.

key.description:
Key is the key for the filter from $event.properties
Currently we support only first level keys in the properties and not nested keys

values.description:
Values are the possible values for the filter to be considered for the meter
For ex "model_name" could have values "o1-mini", "gpt-4o" etc

amount.description:
Amount stored in main currency units (e.g., dollars, not cents)
For USD: 12.50 means $12.50

billing_period_count.description: BillingPeriodCount is the count of the billing period ex 1, 3, 6, 12

conversion_rate.description:
ConversionRate is the rate of the price unit to the base currency
For BTC: 1 BTC = 100000000 USD

currency.description: Currency 3 digit ISO currency code in lowercase ex usd, eur, gbp

display_amount.description:
DisplayAmount is the formatted amount with currency symbol
For USD: $12.50

display_price_unit_amount.description:
DisplayPriceUnitAmount is the formatted amount with price unit symbol
For BTC: 0.00000001 BTC

end_date.description: EndDate is the end date of the price

entity_id.description: EntityID holds the value of the "entity_id" field.

environment_id.description: EnvironmentID is the environment identifier for the price

id.description: ID uuid identifier for the price

lookup_key.description: LookupKey used for looking up the price in the database

meter_id.description: MeterID is the id of the meter for usage based pricing

parent_price_id.description: ParentPriceID references the parent price (only set when scope is SUBSCRIPTION)

price_unit.description:
PriceUnit 3 digit ISO currency code in lowercase ex btc
For BTC: btc

price_unit_amount.description:
PriceUnitAmount is the amount stored in price unit
For BTC: 0.00000001 means 0.00000001 BTC

price_unit_id.description: PriceUnitID is the id of the price unit

price_unit_tiers.description: PriceUnitTiers are the tiers for the price unit

start_date.description: StartDate is the start date of the price

trial_period.description:
TrialPeriod is the number of days for the trial period
Note: This is only applicable for recurring prices (BILLING_CADENCE_RECURRING)

flat_amount.description:
flat_amount is the flat amount for the given tier (optional)
Applied on top of unit_amount*quantity. Useful for cases like "2.7$ + 5c"

unit_amount.description: unit_amount is the amount per unit for the given tier

up_to.description:
up_to is the quantity up to which this tier applies. It is null for the last tier.
IMPORTANT: Tier boundaries are INCLUSIVE.
- If up_to is 1000, then quantity less than or equal to 1000 belongs to this tier
- This behavior is consistent across both VOLUME and SLAB tier modes

environment_id.description: EnvironmentID filters by specific environment ID

filters.description: Filters allows complex filtering based on multiple fields

sort.description: Sort allows sorting by multiple fields

tenant_id.description: TenantID filters by specific tenant ID

environment_id.description: EnvironmentID is the environment identifier for the pause

id.description: ID is the unique identifier for the subscription pause

original_period_end.description: OriginalPeriodEnd is the end of the billing period when the pause was created

original_period_start.description: OriginalPeriodStart is the start of the billing period when the pause was created

pause_end.description: PauseEnd is when the pause will end (null for indefinite)

pause_start.description: PauseStart is when the pause actually started

reason.description: Reason is the reason for pausing

resumed_at.description: ResumedAt is when the pause was actually ended (if manually resumed)

subscription_id.description: SubscriptionID is the identifier for the subscription

filters.description: filters allows complex filtering based on multiple fields
filters allows complex filtering based on multiple fields

amount_due_gt.description:
amount_due_gt filters invoices with a total amount due greater than the specified value
Useful for finding invoices above a certain threshold or identifying high-value invoices

amount_remaining_gt.description:
amount_remaining_gt filters invoices with an outstanding balance greater than the specified value
Useful for finding invoices that still have significant unpaid amounts

customer_id.description:
customer_id filters invoices for a specific customer using FlexPrice's internal customer ID
This is the ID returned by FlexPrice when creating or retrieving customers

external_customer_id.description:
external_customer_id filters invoices for a customer using your system's customer identifier
This is the ID you provided when creating the customer in FlexPrice

invoice_ids.description:
invoice_ids restricts results to invoices with the specified IDs
Use this to retrieve specific invoices when you know their exact identifiers

invoice_status.description:
invoice_status filters by the current state of invoices in their lifecycle
Multiple statuses can be specified to include invoices in any of the listed states

payment_status.description:
payment_status filters by the payment state of invoices
Multiple statuses can be specified to include invoices with any of the listed payment states

skip_line_items.description: SkipLineItems if true, will not include line items in the response

subscription_id.description:
subscription_id filters invoices generated for a specific subscription
Only returns invoices that were created as part of the specified subscription's billing

filters.description: filters allows complex filtering based on multiple fields

x-enum-comments.ProrationBehaviorNone: Calculate but don't apply (e.g., for previews)

x-enum-descriptions: Calculate but don't apply (e.g., for previews)

active_at.description: ActiveAt filters subscriptions that are active at the given time

with_line_items.description: WithLineItems includes line items in the response

allowed_price_types.description:
AllowedPriceTypes is a list of price types that are allowed for the wallet
nil means all price types are allowed

ApiKeyAuth.description: Enter your API key in the format *x-api-key <api-key>**
ApiKeyAuth.name: x-api-key
